Review Text: As a tourist, I really enjoyed visiting this mall! It’s a great place to shop for both luxury brands and local Thai labels. The mall is big, clean, and beautifully designed — perfect for walking around and exploring. There are so many restaurants and cafes to choose from, and there’s almost always an event going on. I also love that it’s connected by a walking bridge to nearby areas, which makes it super convenient to get around. Definitely a must-visit spot when in Bangkok!

CentralWorld – massive and lively shopping hub! 🛍️🌆 CentralWorld is one of Bangkok’s largest and busiest malls. It has an incredible variety of international brands, local shops, restaurants, and cafes, so there’s something for everyone. The mall is modern, clean, and well-organized, but it can get very crowded, especially on weekends or during holidays. The open spaces and impressive atrium make walking around enjoyable, and there are plenty of spots for dining and relaxing. If you love shopping, food, and experiencing the bustling city vibe, CentralWorld is a must-visit. Just be ready for crowds!

A super huge mall with plenty of shopping 🛍 and F&B. It's also convenient to get here since it's near the BTS station. I came here 3 consecutive days to get food & desserts. Loads of great foid here. The shopping brands are also more down to earth. Not just caters for the rich.

CentralWorld in Bangkok is a shopper's paradise! This massive mall has everything you could possibly want, from high-end brands to local finds. I was blown away by the variety of stores and the modern architecture. It's easy to spend hours wandering around. Plus, there are tons of restaurants and cafes to keep you fueled up. If you're looking for a one-stop shopping and entertainment destination in Bangkok, CentralWorld is a must-visit!"

Luxury mall with lot of different outlet. Good for window shopping. The electric equipment’s prices are really good here but shoe prices are way higher than it should be. Nice place to roam around as a tourist. Need cash card to buy food is the only thing I struggled personally apart from that everything is ok.

Central World is one of those malls that truly has almost everything. It’s huge, and every time I go I feel like there’s something new to discover. One of the highlights for me is the larger UNIQLO, which has way more variety than most other locations, making it fun to browse through for clothes. And of course, I can never leave without grabbing a snack at Auntie Anne’s, which has become a little tradition for me there. With its size, variety, and energy, Central World really feels like a place where you can spend hours and never run out of things to do.

The impressive structure offers a wide array of retail options for visitors. One can find numerous stores selling clothing, electronics, and various other goods inside. Additionally, there are many restaurants and cafes to choose from for a quick meal or a leisurely break. The complex also features entertainment options such as cinemas and amusement areas. Ultimately, it provides a comprehensive experience for shoppers and leisure seekers alike.

Great mall to spend the day in. This place is very well designed to have all the families on a certain floor, all the tech enthusiast on another floor, all the fashion stores on the bottom floor, all the food and restaurants on the top floor. You finish the day watching a movie at the cinema on the top floor. Lots of tourist visit your mall. Good job centralwOrld!

A shopper’s paradise and a must visit if you’re in Bangkok! This huge mall offers a great mix of local and international brands, amazing food options, and something for everyone. You could easily spend hours here.

The most vibrant mall, with people constantly coming and going, from opening to closing. Every shop is modern and fresh, selling trendy items. There are always interesting events being held here. Everyone should not miss a visit to this mall.
This mall has a crazy big food court ! 6th and 7th floor! You can find everything .. There is also a very big supermarket . Some stalls are only cash payment but most of them accept card.

Another big shopping centre in the Pathunmwan district. Lot of big name stores such as Victoria Secret, Gentle Monster, Marimeko, Sephora etc. Plenty of cafes & dining venues throughout the different floors. There is also a large area of food court & a supermarket. We enjoyed lots of window shopping. Also stopped for lunch at a restaurant by the food court. Everything was delicious & fresh. But isn’t everything is in Thailand? Delish! 😍👍🏻 A great place to be so make sure you put this venue as part of your trip when you visit Bangkok!

The real deal mall of South East Asia! A bit on the high pricey side but worth it and you can be there for hours shopping and eating. They have everything you want and need from food to electronics to pharmacy goods, toileteries, snacks, dessert, bubble tea, toys etc. disabled friendly and child friendly. It is massive and you can get lost there. The air conditioning is good and it’s a nice reprieve from the stifling heat or a good place to spend time when it is raining buckets. Been here way too many times since 2007

It was a huge shopping mall in Bangkok. Couldn’t have the opportunity to explore the mall due to time limitations. However, the building design was great and impressive! Night view from outside of the mall was totally WOW! Great spot for photo shooting at the link bridge.

One word to describe this place… Massive. It’s none stop connections after connections. Floors after floors. Stores after stores. Every type and every style, from your mom and pa shop, family business to all the name brands you can think of. The traffic is ridiculously busy. Cars and people are like ants 🐜, nonstop, it’s unbelievable. Will I come back probably but maybe figure out a different drop off and pick up spot, avoid the main entrances. It’s a mess! It’s a much better shopping center than ICONSIAM. Way more things to do.

We spent two full days in Central World shopping mall. We enjoyed our time with shopping; from the luxury brand shops to the shops with super sale! There are many good restaurants in the shopping mall and a small market outside. After visiting many shopping malls in Bangkok including the newly opened Central Park, we liked Central World the most. We are already looking forward to going back.

As a travel enthusiast, I was truly amazed by how elegant and sophisticated CentralWorld is! The mall exudes a luxurious vibe—from its chic interiors to its wide selection of high-end stores. I had a lovely dinner at one of the restaurants on the upper floor. Before heading back to my country, I couldn’t resist grabbing a cute and delicious cake from one of the dessert shops—it was the sweetest way to end my trip! 🧁🇹🇭

It’s huge, beautiful and modern design with thousands of different shops. There are lots of fun and entertainment for everyone. Top quality brands are available in the Central World shopping centre. We visited during the food festival and ate lots of yum food and fresh 🍉 .🍇

One of the places you might want to visit. In this place, if you are someone who likes shopping, looking for souvenirs to take home, or you want to buy clothes and want to find delicious food, this place provides it, you just come and make a choice. Don't forget to have enough money to come to this place. I'm sure you will have a good experience here.

🏢 A Major Shopping Landmark in the Heart of the Business District If you're in the area, this massive shopping mall is an essential stop — especially considering its central location in the heart of the business zone. Being so easily accessible makes it a popular destination with a high footfall every day. 🚶‍♀️🚶‍♂️ 🛍️ Endless Shopping Options for Every Style & Budget The mall is huge — it can easily take 4 to 5 hours to explore fully! You'll find a wide variety of stores, ranging from luxury brands to more budget-friendly options, making it ideal for every type of shopper. Whether you're looking for fashion, tech, home goods, or gifts, this place has it all. 👜👟📱 🍜 Diverse Dining Options Across Two Floors The 6th and 7th floors are entirely dedicated to food, and there are plenty of options for every taste and budget — from local street-style dishes to international cuisine. 🍱🍕🍔 However, one important note for those with dietary restrictions: 🔸 Most restaurants serve pork, which may not be suitable for everyone. 🔸 If you are looking for halal food, there is one halal-certified restaurant located on the 6th floor, and another spot that serves only beef ramen, which may be a safe option for some. 🍜✅ 🥢 Fresh, Flavorful Asian Cuisine As someone who enjoys Asian cuisine, I was delighted by the freshness and taste of the Asian dishes I tried. Everything was served hot, quickly, and full of flavor. If you're a fan of sushi, ramen, or wok-style meals, you’ll love it here. 🍣🌶️🍚 😊 Friendly Staff & Quick Service The service was very satisfying: Staff were polite, well-dressed, and cheerful Most team members speak adequate English, making communication much easier for international visitors Tables were clean, and the whole environment felt organized despite the crowd 🧼💬 Fast service and a professional attitude made the experience even better! ✅ Final Thoughts This mall combines convenience, variety, and quality in a single destination. I will definitely be returning for both shopping and dining. Whether you're a tourist, an expat, or a local, this place is well worth a visit. Highly recommended! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
